meanings.definition: The pointed top of a mountain.
meanings.sent1: The climbers reached the snowy peaks of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: From the top of the peak, they could see for miles.
meanings.sent3: The peak of the mountain looked like a giant hat.
meanings.sent4: The peak of the mountain pierced the sky like a sharp arrow.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting behind the peak painted the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: The highest point or level reached.
meanings.sent1: Her excitement reached its peak when she won the race.
meanings.sent2: The peak of his career was when he won the award.
meanings.sent3: The peak of the party was when the cake fell on the floor.
meanings.sent4: The peak of the mountain of laundry seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent5: The peak of the roller coaster provided an exhilarating view.

meanings.definition: To reach a highest point or level.
meanings.sent1: The hiker slowly peaks the mountain, enjoying the journey.
meanings.sent2: The athlete aims to peak at the right moment during the race.
meanings.sent3: The excitement in the room peaks as the magician reveals the trick.
meanings.sent4: Her performance in the play will peak during the emotional scene.
meanings.sent5: The demand for the product is expected to peak during the holiday season.
